Mr. Harold E. Hill
March 23, 1965
Page 2
Howard Holst, chairman of the site selection committee, could not attend the
meeting, and Leonard Press reported for him. The site tentatively suggested
was Memphis, but no date was set. (The idea of checking with national head¬
quarters before setting a date was firmly implanted. ) Later in the meeting,
Len Press asked for a straw vote indicating reaction to holding each meeting in
some very central city, such as Atlanta. This suggestion did not seem to be
well taken, and Len said he would "keep the matter under advisement". Inciden¬
tally, Graydon Ausmus had suggested to me that every other annual meeting be
held in a centrally located city, which suggestion I passed along to Len Press.
Hugh DeSamper did an excellent job as chairman of the Host Committee,
including Jim Sawyer of William and Mary, Randy Brent of WHRO-TV, and
Bill Spiller of WCVE-TV. I wish you could have been there with us.
With best wishes,
Sincerely:
John/p oung
Conference Chairman
